III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility
is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements except for the following:
This facility is non-contracted with Michigan Department of Health and Human
Services therefore, MISEP requirements are not applicable.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract/Policy violation. Please
note that there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS
Contract/Policy requirements except for the following:
This facility is non-contracted with Michigan Department of Health and Human
Services, therefore, MDHHS Policy/MDHHS contract are not applicable.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
- The facility has changed their organizational chart where the treatment staff for the
dentition center treatment center program will no longer be supervised directly by
the dentition program and will be supervised by the field services director. This
consultant provided assistance with making sure the treatment staff that are
working with the youth under this current licensed will need to make sure they are
following the Licensing Rules for Juvenile Court Operated Facilities, such as the
training needs, employee records, etc.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was not in need of consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The facility has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period in response to the 2021 Interim Inspection.
The facility implemented the corrective action plan successfully regarding tuberculosis
screening for employees and volunteers and initial staff orientation and ongoing staff
training. The Human Resource Department has been using the Juvenile Detention
Candidate checklist to make sure all new employees have tuberculosis testing
4

cleared prior to employment. Within this audit renewal it was found all new employees
have completed their tuberculosis testing prior to employment. The Superintendent
and Assistant Superintendent have been tracking staff training hours since the last
corrective action plan to make sure all training needs are being met which has been
successfully as all staff have met the training requirements within this audit.
An onsite tour was completed on 05/19/2022. The facility was observed to be clean
and well maintained. Ample staff were present and observed to be supervising the
residents. This consultant viewed all the pod areas where the youth are residing, and
it was observed to be clean and well maintained. Currently PODs A and E are not
being utilized and POD D is being utilized as a quarantine pod for youth with COVID-
19 concerns. Residents were attending their onsite schooling during the tour and
some were observed to be within the gym playing basketball.
During staff interviews staff reported feeling both staff and residents are safe at the
facility and supervision is provided as required. Staff are given ample training
opportunities and feel supported by management. Residents indicated they
participate in a variety of recreational and education activities including life skill
building. Residents reported feeling safe at the facility. Both staff and residents
interviewed stated residents are only restrained after staff have attempted to verbally
deescalate the situation first and is used as a last resort. Neither staff nor residents
indicated concerns with restraints they observed or participated in.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the facility be issued a renewal of their
regular license.
